verses.roman:
sahasra-kare jala seke, sahasra netre gopī dekhe,
sahasra-pade nikaṭa gamane
sahasra-mukha-cumbane, sahasra-vapu-saṅgame,
gopī-narma śune sahasra-kāṇe

synonyms: sahasra—thousands; kare—with hands; jala—water; seke—throw; sahasra—thousands; netre—with eyes; gopī—the gopīs; dekhe—see; sahasra—thousands; pade—with legs; nikaṭa—near; gamane—in going; sahasra—thousands; mukha—faces; cumbane—kissing; sahasra—thousands; vapu—bodies; saṅgame—in embracing; gopī—the gopīs; narma—joking; śune—hear; sahasra—thousands; kāṇe—in ears.
translation: "Thousands of hands splashed water, and the gopīs saw Kṛṣṇa with thousands of eyes. With thousands of legs they came near Him and kissed Him with thousands of faces. Thousands of bodies embraced Him. The gopīs heard His joking words with thousands of ears.
